doc.field: Series I: Labor unions and organizations
Series I: Labor unions and organizations
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection of Labor Movement Serials

This series collects publications issued by construction and building trades unions, mainly through the 20th century. Large organizations of painters, molders, miners, chemical workers, and engineers -- including the American Federation of Technical Engineers, and the United Steelworkers of America -- are represented at both the national and local level. Smaller organizations and rank and file groups are represented by newsletters circulated to raise awareness around topics including health issues among miners (Miner's Voice; Progressive Miner; Straight Track); safety regulations governing the construction industry (variants of the widely distributed Hard Hat News; Rusty Nail; Construction Labor News); and corruption in Local 282 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters (published by Fear of Reprisal Ends).
